SUPPLIER COMPLIANCE LEVEL: Complied
SUPPLER COMMENT: Wafer Tracking Requirement for Multi-module Equipment
For any multi module equipment, it is required for the equipment to report wafer processing and wafer location events to the host whenever the wafer is being processed through each module. Such events are also to be logged in the equipment log file for future references.
Such equipment wafer tracking capability has to be compliant with SEMI E90 standard.
SUPPLIER COMPLIANCE LEVEL:Complied
SUPPLER COMMENT: Wafer Split/Merger ‚ÄìSorter Requirement Allow host to create 2nd ( and 3rd ‚Ä¶ , if necessary) recipe and Job (CJ, PJ) without removing carrier.
It can avoid user is hard to identify and handle the job failed during multi-FOUP's job.
Allow host to exchange/sort wafer position, for instance Slot1, 2 changes to Slot2, 1. This function should be accomplished without empty carrier assistance.
SUPPLIER COMPLIANCE LEVEL: NA
SUPPLER COMMENT: Furnacespecific Requirement
Host requires dummy carrier expired event, this event must come with at least a carrier id SVID.
EQP notify expired event automatically.
SUPPLIER COMPLIANCE LEVEL: ______________N/A___________________________________
SUPPLER COMMENT: __________________________________________________________ Metrology Tool Requirement
When there is measurement data error (e.g. empty value), tool has to allow host to execute re-measure job without removing carrier.
Production people , don't want to : CANCEL JOB-IN , REMOVE FOUP and then PLACE FOUP for re-measure.
SUPPLIER COMPLIANCE LEVEL: ___________________N/A______________________________
SUPPLER COMMENT: __________________________________________________________ Etch tool Requirement
Tool must provide the alarm or event report while the dummy wafer usage count expired.
EQP notify expired event automatically.
SUPPLIER COMPLIANCE LEVEL: _______NA__________________________________________
SUPPLER COMMENT: __________________________________________________________ Automation Acceptance
LEVEL TWO (Automation Performance Level) EAP developer has finished EAP development and is ready to release the equipment to volume production environment. HiDM shall focus on the reliability and stability of the automation functions at this level. The following items will be the monitoring criteria.
(a) Requirement of data quality mentioned in chapter 3 and chapter 4 shall be monitored and validated.
(b) HiDM is executing an EAP release cycle, this cycle goes through the authorized persons from different departments. The equipment automation is accepted when the release cycle is finished.
(c) If any of item (a) is violated, it is tool vendor‚Äôs obligation to send either software head or programmer to HiDM FAB to diagnose and resolve the problems. The aggressive attitude is encouraged.
(d) If the problem is not resolved when the monitoring period comes to end, the monitor period shall be extended until the problem is resolved.Worse, the equipment shall be rejected.

messages.content: How do I get add but only files that are already being tracked?

### Answer:
Comply with clarification.

### Explanation:
The response to the query about adding only files that are already being tracked is to comply with clarification. This means that the action is supported but with specific conditions or additional information provided. The exact details of the clarification are not provided in the sources, but it generally implies that there are certain steps or conditions to be met to ensure compliance. [1]

root Í≥ÑÏ†ïÏùò Ìå®Ïä§ÏõåÎìú Ï†ïÎ≥¥Í∞Ä ÎÖ∏Ï∂úÎêòÏßÄ ÏïäÎèÑÎ°ù Ìï®.","Modify configuration file to prevent direct access to the root account via FTP.
(Add the root account to the ftpusers file, which is where accounts with denied access are registered.)","<Restict root access via regular FTP service>
1. Open the ftpusers file using the vi editor. (‚Äú/etc/ftpusers‚Äù or ‚Äú/etc/ftpd/ftpusers‚Äù)
#vi /etc/ftpusers or /etc/ftpd/ftpusers
2. Add the root account to the ftpusers file or remove comment.
(before) #root or the root account is not registered
(after ) root
<How to stop ProFTP service>
1. Open the proftpd configuration file (‚Äú/etc/proftpd.conf‚Äù) using the vi editor.
#vi /etc/proftpd.conf
2. Configure RootLogin off in the proftpd configuration file (‚Äú/etc/proftpd.conf‚Äù).
(before) RootLogin on
(after) RootLogin off
<How to stop vsFTP service>
1. Open the ftpusers file using the vi editor. (‚Äú/etc/vsftp/ftpusers‚Äù or ‚Äú/etc/vsftpd.ftpusers‚Äù)
#vi /etc/vsftp/ftpusers
2. Add the root account to the ftpusers file or remove comment.
(before) #root or the root account is not registered
(after ) root
‚Äª FTP access control file when using vsFTP: (1) If userlist_enable=YES in the vsftpd.conf file, vsftpd.ftpusers, vsftpd.userlist
(Access is denied for all accounts registered in the ftpusers and user_list files.)
(2) If userlist_enable=NO or, if no option is set in the vsftpd.conf file, vsftpd.ftpusers
(Access is denied only for accounts registered in the ftpusers file.)","<Restict root access via regular FTP service>
1. Open the ftpusers file using the vi editor. (‚Äú/etc/ftpusers‚Äù or ‚Äú/etc/ftpd/ftpusers‚Äù)

title: üíª Git add tracked

messages.content: How do I git add but only files that are already being tracked?

To add only the files that are already being tracked by Git, you can use the following command:

```sh
git add -u
```

The `-u` (or `--update`) option tells Git to update the index with the content from the working tree that matches the HEAD commit. This means it will only add changes to files that are already being tracked and will not add any new untracked files.

title: üîß Lam's EDA Freeze 2 response

messages.content: What is the Lam response to EDA Freeze 2?

### Answer:
Do not comply.

### Explanation:
Lam Research does not comply with the SEMI Standard (Freeze Version II 0710) for EDA Freeze 2. This is indicated by the response "DO NOT COMPLY" for the specified requirement [3].

SUPPLIER COMPLIANCE LEVEL: ____________________________________________________
SUPPLER COMMENT: ____________________________________________________________ Detail Requirement Descriptions
Equipment User Interface
Wafer ID and CARRIER ID Display User Interface (UI)
For equipment that are equipped with Carrier ID Read/Write (CIDRW) system and Wafer ID reading system, the CARRIER ID and the Wafer ID have to be visible to the operator through the equipment user interface
SUPPLIER COMPLIANCE LEVEL: _ Comply _
SUPPLER COMMENT: __________________________________________________________ Equipment Terminal Service
This function allows the host to display information on the equipment display device or the operator of the equipment to send information to the host. All equipment is to support this basic terminal service requirement.
SUPPLIER COMPLIANCE LEVEL: _ Comply _
SUPPLER COMMENT: __________________________________________________________ There must be no UI display unit installed within the ‚Äúrestricted zone‚Äù
There must be no UI display unit installed within the ‚Äúrestricted zone‚Äù. ‚ÄúRestricted zone‚Äù is defined to be any area that is directly above the equipment Load Port or in-between the Load Port if that distance is less than 16 cm
SUPPLIER COMPLIANCE LEVEL: _ Comply _
SUPPLER COMMENT: __________________________________________________________
Equipment Host Communications Capabilities
Equipment Control Mode
¬∑ Equipment has to provide the following three standard communication mode with host: Offline, Online/Local and Online/Remote. Definition of these modes is as defined in the SEMI E30 (GEM) standard.
¬∑ For every mode change that is generated at the equipment, equipment must send an event to the host to notify the mode change following SEMI E30 (GEM) standard.
¬∑ Equipment must allow host to query and change the communication mode.
¬∑ Equipment must provide separate equipment control mode for each Load Port and the control mode for each Load Port must be exclusively independent on the other Load Ports in the equipment
SUPPLIER COMPLIANCE LEVEL: _ Comply _
SUPPLER COMMENT: __________________________________________________________ Equipment Single Communication Interface
Equipment has to provide a single physical communication link between the host and the equipment to perform remote commands and monitor events for the following distinct automation parts:
¬∑ Wafer location tracking, movement control and processing within Equipment and within equipment multi-modules (if there is any)
¬∑ Wafer movement control and tracking at Load Port
¬∑ Carrier ID read and write
¬∑ Equipment Signal Tower Control
¬∑ Wafer ID read (If equipment is equipped with wafer ID reading system)
The communication protocol must be compliant to SEMI E37 and E54 SUPPLIER COMPLIANCE LEVEL: M/D
SUPPLER COMMENT: __________________________________________________________
Equipment SEMI E37 [HSMS] Basic Requirement
¬∑ Equipment physical link has to be at least, maybe in more high rate 10/100 Ethernet connections with RJ45 connector
¬∑ Need to be able to handle all normal communications and control functions at sub-second response time
¬∑ Able to process no less than 200 trace data points per second while not impacting the equipment normal processing
¬∑ Need to support SEMI E37.1 [HSMS-SS]
¬∑ Any active communications with host should not have significant impact on the other TCP/IP or HSMS entities on the network Communication Standards Requirement
SUPPLIER COMPLIANCE LEVEL: M/D
SUPPLER COMMENT: __________________________________________________________ Equipment SEMI E30 [GEM] Requirement
¬∑ Equipment is to meet the following SEMI GEM [E30] requirements necessary to be termed GEM compliant:
(1) State Models
(2) Equipment Processing States
(3) Host-initiated S1F13/S1F14 Scenario
(4) Event Notification
(5) On-Line Identification
(6) Error Messages
(7) Documentation
(8) Control (Operator initiated)
(9) Establish communications
(10) Dynamic Event Report configuration
(11) Variable Data Collection
(12) Status Data Collection
(13) Trace Data Collection
(14) Alarm Management
(15) Remote Control
(16) Equipment Constants
(17) Process Program Management
(18) Material Movement (according to SEMI E87)
(19) Equipment Terminal Service
(20) Clock
(21) Limits Monitoring
(22) Spooling
(23) Control (Host-initiated)
¬∑ Suppliers are required to document the operational behavior of their equipment using state model methodology [E30]
SUPPLIER COMPLIANCE LEVEL: M/D

List of Variables
The equipment suppliers must comply with the list of variables that are stated in the ¬∑ SEMI E39.1-1102, ¬∑ SEMI E40.1-1101, ¬∑ SEMI E42.1-0997, ¬∑ SEMI E58.1-0697, ¬∑ SEMI E87.1-0702, ¬∑ SEMI E90.1-0303, ¬∑ SEMI E94.1-1101 and ¬∑ SEMI E99.1-0303. The details of the variables list will not be described here.
SUPPLIER COMPLIANCE LEVEL: M/D
SUPPLER COMMENT: List of variables will be provided to SiEn. NM for E42, E58 and E99.
Supplementary requirements
Sorter supplementary requirement
1. Sorter Equipment equipped with n load ports must support split/merge process among n FOUPs in one Control Job.---
2. Sorter Equipment must support to align angle by wafer base. ---
3. When carrier with one control job gets COMPLETED, equipment must support to create another control job for same carrier without removal. ---
Furnace tools supplementary requirement---
1) Furnace tool must include the monitor wafer control, layout control, filled dummy and side dummy control.
2) Furnace tool must provide OBJECT ID for process/recipe step change event.
3) Furnace tool must provide the capability to allow host to tune process parameters for each batch.
4) Slot map must be verified in loadport.
5) Furnace tool must report boat/tube information by wafer when batch end. The information includes:
¬∑ LotID, WaferID and SlotId
¬∑ Wafer position in boat/tube
6) Tool should support Host send the multiple ‚ÄúCarrier-Out‚Äù commands simultaneously, and equipment must be capable of queuing these ‚ÄúCarrier-Out‚Äù commands and execute them sequentially.
7) Tool should can Support Host ‚ÄúCarrier Out‚Äù command both with and without portId specification.
Wet Bench tools supplementary requirement---
1) Equipment must support to query :
¬∑ Current life count and lifetime
¬∑ Life count and lifetime for chemical change
2) tool must report information by wafer when batch end:
¬∑ Lot ID, Wafer ID, and Slot ID
¬∑ tank ID and wafer position
3) Tool should support Host send the multiple ‚ÄúCarrier-Out‚Äù commands simultaneously, and equipment must be capable of queuing these ‚ÄúCarrier-Out‚Äù commands and execute them sequentially. 4) Tool should can Support Host ‚ÄúCarrier Out‚Äù command both with and without portId specification.
General supplementary requirement for all tools---
1) Tool should report processed wafer count for each PJ.
2) In both automatic and manual handoffs, host must make no difference in communication between the AUTO handoff and the MANUAL handoff. Must notify host when handoff state changes.
3) Equipment suppliers should provide detailed Recipe Format Document to decode recipe body.
4) Before Recipe body/list upload, host should not set any equipment constants in equipment to identify what kind of recipe needs to upload. 5) Recipe parameter tuning in S16Fy must be limited within current PJ.

¬∑ Equipment suppliers are expected to provide SECS/GEM message scenarios for host/equipment initialization, normal processing and exceptional case handling procedure--- M/D
¬∑ Equipment suppliers are required to document the operational behavior of their equipment using state model methodology [E30] --- M/D
¬∑ Equipment suppliers are expected to provide SECS/GEM manual. The documentation of the manual have to at least include the following topics: --- M/D
¬∑ Table of contents
¬∑ Introduction ¬∑ Listing of the SECS Standard followed.
¬∑ Version of GEM followed with exceptions.
¬∑ GEM Compliance table
¬∑ Physical Connection (Type of connector & location)
¬∑ Equipment Configuration Procedure
¬∑ Configuring HSMS parameters.
¬∑ System User Interface
¬∑ Performance or other issues (i.e. Trace Capability)
¬∑ State models and Equipment process states.
¬∑ Message Summary
¬∑ List Host to Equipment message
¬∑ List Equipment to Host message
¬∑ Variables, Constants & Commands (Each variable or constant must list the ID#, data format, values and definition. Note: VID numbers shall have one consistent format)
¬∑ List Collection Events (User defined report can be linked to the event).
¬∑ List Data Variables (Previous state or last stored value)
¬∑ List Status Variables (Current state of equipment or value of an equipment sensor that can be sampled).
¬∑ List Equipment Constants (Pre set Limits or static value)
¬∑ List the Remote Command, parameters that can be passed with each command and the required control state for executing each remote command.
¬∑ Describe the states, events and conditions on the equipment using a formal method that is provided through the interface
¬∑ SECS/GEM message detail
¬∑ Describe notation used for message in document (i.e. SML)
¬∑ Provide notation and description for each message. For Example: S6F15-Event report request S6F15 W H->E <U4 CEID> *Collection Event id Host sends specific CEID to request report
¬∑ SECS/GEM scenarios
¬∑ List the SECS/GEM scenarios supported on the equipment 2) At software installation:
¬∑ Equipment suppliers are expected to send automation software engineer to perform automation software installation and perform pre automation software acceptance check--- M/D
3) Automation Software Acceptance:
¬∑ Equipment Suppliers are expected to discover and solve all major bugs that will cause host not to function accurately and safely (in terms of operation safety and production safety) within 1 week of automation software acceptance testing--- ¬∑ SienIDM reserves the right to alter the automation compliance test content for the acceptance ---
M/D: Standard testing is provided to assure compliance to standards as documented in the manual. M/C: If additional special testing is required, negotiations for special testing activities may be requested as added cost option
¬∑ Automation Software Acceptance test is considered successful when
¬∑ All test items have passed and acknowledged by the responsible SienIDM equipment engineer, process engineer and IT engineer
¬∑ All required documents are duly submitted
¬∑ All major bugs have been resolved within 1 week of automation software acceptance testing and do not have any recurrence within 1 month after the equipment is released to production by SienIDM Process Engineer--- Agree to work with SiEn and to negotiate and resolve issues non-compliant with SECS/Gem Manual or any special feature commitments in the spec response based on mutually agreed schedule.
4) Equipment suppliers‚Äô Services After Automation Software Acceptance:
¬∑ Equipment suppliers are expected to send experienced automation software engineer to support SienIDM at startup period. This period is expected to last for a period of 3 to 6 months after equipment is first released to production for running--- M/D: Comply with experienced local team support. M/C: Comply with purchase of added cost option for on-site support from Fremont Factory if required. Price to be negotiated based on level and duration of requested support
¬∑ When SECS/GEM software version is updated, equipment suppliers should inform SienIDM immediately. SienIDM can decide to use different equipment software version (include new release version) with free charge.---
M/D: Software upgrades may occasionally include changes in the SECS/GEM area of software. Standard options are available free of charge during warranty period. Changes are documented in release notes.
M/C: Special features may be offered as added cost option upgrades which YMTC can decide to acquire or skip. In addition, beyond warranty maintenance contracts and/or purchases will be made available as added cost options
¬∑ Payment
If the system does not meet the automation specification at required time, SienIDM will reserve the right to hold the final payment until the problems have been solved.
